caption: Great place to enjoy a nice authentic Italian meal 😋 Quick and friendly service
Food was amazing, the service was amazing, the owner is the nicest person you'll ever want to meet.
Awesome food, nice employees, consistently excellent vibes. They charge convenient pricing and the food quality is good. Keep it up.
Great restaurant
The best chicken scarpariello I’ve tried. Had the dish a few times. Wish they would bring back the lunch specials

I saw Mario's on Actions Bronson's series (F That's Delicious) on Vice, but was familiar from the Bronx Beer Hall + UVS first Saturdays next door. The margherita pizza is incredible. I'll be back to dine indoors soon.
The best Italian restaurant in Arthur Avenue.

My parents and I shared burrata and procuitto on a bed of arugula with balsamic glaze and calamari for the appetizer. The burrata was good. You could tell the calamari was very fresh.  For dinner we shared paperdelle with short ribs. I wish it had rosemary or a fresh herb as garnish. We also had the veal saltimbocca. My mom claimed several times it was the best saltimbocca she's ever had and it's one of my favorite meals. We shared a pitcher of their red sangria which was good, but I wish it had some rosemary in there to bring a little more life to it. We were very satisfied with the meal and had a wonderful time. We would definitely return!
The food was good good and the staff was pleasant and attentive and respectful.  It was a pleasure to dine at Mario's and you must try the spicy meatballs
Mario's restaurant wasn't my first choice to go eat at on arthur ave in the Bronx but it was definitely a good second choice,first choice of course was rigoletos

Ordered tripe but what I got was 98% onions and maybe 5% tripe extremely disappointed in quality of food over priced and food had NO TASTE they were a great restaurant now it seems like they don't care what they serve people also chicken scappriello has sausage in it didn't get sausage WILL NEVER GO BACK CHARGE HIGH PRICES AND YOU GET NOTHING IN PLATE BUT ONIONS AND GARLIC
Good stuff here
Very good service,nice atmosphere.beatiful place.go and enjoy yourself!!

For YEARS my family has been dining, laughing, enjoying and connecting over scrumptious food at Mario’s... It’s an experience-a tradition-family... The food is incredible and they will make anything exactly how you wish... But the people; they are why we have been traveling to the Bronx for more than 50 years. The energy, vibe, warmth and setting is unmatched. TOP DISHES: fettuccini filet di pomodoro; clams oreganata, chicken parm, PIZZA, linguini with white clam sauce... It’s a not too miss EXPERIENCE.
Fabulous outside dining even in the cold and rain
Authentic
Best pizza! If you're near arthur avenue definitely stop in! A real neighborhood spot.
Missing the normal vibe
I love their soup...a must!
Great service and food!
Great food.  Safe and inviting environment.   Will be back soon.
Awesome and delicious food, I love the vibes the spot has, and the cashiers were kind. I will surely come back.
Delicious! Everything was delightful.

After reading several reviews I was excited to go to Mario’s, but unfortunately the food was disappointing. My pasta was over-cooked and the eggplant parmigiana was not good at all. Your best bet is their pizza.
Light and fluffy gnocchi and tasty pizza. Prices are reasonable. Highly recommended.

Our server at Mario’s was brilliant. He was very experienced and could tell that I was having a hard time deciding what to order, so I just told him I was a vegetarian and he immediately came up with a dish that sounded like it was exactly what I wanted. It was like he read my mind! Both me and my friend’s pasta dishes were delicious.

Ok readers, let me explain briefly the reason behind a 3 star review for famed and renowned landmark restaurant on Arthur, Mario's. The service is delightful, with a special regard to House Manager Regina, who greeted our table with sincerity and even made my mother, who frequented Mario's often in the past, with familiarity. Excellent touch to service. Here is the thing, the courses we ordered were very miss. Let's start with the Escargot which was soaked in butter and olive oil. If you are a connoisseur of snails, you'd prolly be better off eating warm bread and margarine. The Branzino which though was pretty delightful in taste, was alil sparse on size and be careful to find the occasional bone in the bite. It was accompanied as requested with spinach that laid on a small plate drenched in liquid that did nothing to present delectable. And the taste, well, heavenly consumed with garlic. The lasagna which I presumed to be a staple especially on Arthur, I found to be lacking in substance, namely, ground beef. Each bite was more noodles with an air of ricotta than anything else and lastly the Creme Brulee cheesecake, is just cheesecake. If you are hoping for a creamy caramelized fusion, you may be disappointed as we were. The only dish that I could truly recommend from our order is the calamari though that's not saying much to diversity. These days good pizza spots can knock that one out the park. I think perhaps, a spruce of the menu is in order.
Delicious!
Great restaurant, food was exquisite. The service was fantastic.

I came here for the first time ever a few months ago with some friends. We shared some appetizers which were decent, no complaints, but they weren't extraordinary, especially given the reputation for this place. I ordered the chicken cacciatore and it was absolutely the worst I've ever had. They used old, poor quality prosciutto which ruined the whole dish. If anyone has ever had the unfortunate experience of tasting stale prosciutto, you'll know it's very unpleasant and overpowering. The entire dish was overwhelmed with that horrid flavor. I didn't send it back, even though I most definitely should have, because that's not something I could do without my mind being stuck on the thought of my food possibly being tampered with for the rest of the meal. Either way, my dinner was ruined and I won't be coming back here. They should be ensuring their ingredients are fresh before serving a meal
My experience there was amazing we would Drive from Upstate NY to Mario’s often service was amazing food. Was amazing too waiters are the best my favorite place
The place serves large portions and for fair pricing. very kind staff. Never disappointing.
The food is great and  also the service

(Translated by Google) Found it by chance, great authentic atmosphere, delicious food, good service. A little piece of Italy in the Bronx. Highly recommended.  (Original) Zufällig drauf gestoßen, großartige authentische Atmosphäre, leckeres Essen, guter Service. Ein kleines Stück Italien in der Bronx. Sehr empfehlenswert.
Just what you’d expect from Arthur ave.  Traditional great meal.
What a great dining experience! Delicious veal dishes and great service too.
They charged $7 for a very mediocre cappuccino and rang it up as a “special item.” Will not be returning here.
Delicious food and wonderful desert!

One of the better Italian restaurants in New York. Even though the place was very busy, we received our food quickly. To start, we got calamari, spiedini, and baked clams. The calamari was good, very crispy, and not oily or soggy. The anchovy sauce that came with the spiedini is what made the dish great. The baked clams were delicious, not chewy with a delicious  filling. For my main course, I ordered the salmon Regina. The topping on the salmon was delicious, and the fish was fresh. For our table, we ordered rigatoni, which had a delicious vodka sauce with peas, shallots, and prosciutto. This was outstanding, and quite possible the best pasta I have ever eaten. However, the best part of the meal was how all the deserts were nut free. My sister and I both have but allergies, and it was great that we could eat dessert, which is not something we usually can do. For dessert, I ordered a cannoli, which was delicious. The shell was light and crispy, and the filling was smooth and creamy. Hope I can come back soon.

We went on Valentine's day. The place was very busy. I had a reservation and was seated quickly. Our server was prompt and attentive. The food was enjoyable. Only gave 4 * due to the close proxmity of tables for the holiday. Im looking forward to going back during a less peak time. If the service then matches last time, they could score 5.
This old gem (more than 100 years old?) never disappoint with classic Italian dishes : fried calamari, eggplant parmigiana ...
Lousy tacky waiter
It was not my 1st time t I there but like always it was AMAZING

Definitely deserve all 5 stars. The space can appear a bit dark and dated but the service was great. The food was fresh and well seasoned and cooked with very fair portions. The sole in particular was fantastic as was the pasta I had. Good options on the menu and the dinner and lunch specials. Very happy with the place and can’t wait to come back.
Very best Italian food, love it
Great quality food, staff & service.
Good Italian food. Simple dishes done well. Great service. Would recommend.
Decent, but not stellar.  Crowded.

This is the quintessential Arthur ave Italian restaurant. The decor is cheesy old school Italian (in a good way) service is good and food is amazing. Although the starters were only ok (Cesar salad, stuffed artichoke, and stuffed clams) the mains were amazing. Don’t pass up the penne a la vodka or the veal sorrentina as both are amazing. Awesome experience - we’ll definitely be back.
House made mozzarella, fresh basil, tomatoes, balsamic & olive oil, the calamari was crispy but melted in my mouth. Huge portions. Outstanding! As was our hard working waiter.
Awesome food
Everything here is 5 stars and they take pride in their food. Joe is a pleasure to talk to and just when you thought your meal couldnt have been better.....you need to try the desserts.

(Translated by Google) This restaurant has been around since the time Italian immigrants came here. In the 1980's and 90's, the security around the city became poor and Italian immigrants formed a Self-Defense Force to protect the Italian town. Since it has been operating almost after isolation, even the Italians retain their nostalgic taste. There are also many famous Italian mafia, so if you talk to an old clerk, you will find amazing mafia stories. It seems that Benjamin Siegel, a buggy, was at this restaurant when he was at the bottom.  Written in Japanese  (Original) イタリア移民がこの地に来た頃からあるレストラン。80年代90年代はこの街の周辺の治安が悪くなりイタリア移民が自衛団を作ってイタリア人街を守りました。そのほぼ鎖国状態を経て営業を続けているので、イタリア人ですら懐かしい味を維持しています。 有名なイタリアマフィアも多数訪れていますので、年老いた店員さんに話しかけると、驚くべきマフィア話をしてくれます。バグジーことベンジャミン シーゲルも下っ端だった頃このレストランに来ていたそうです。  Written in Japanese
Took a long time to get the food and the food wasn't the best Italian food. Missing some key ingredients. Service was mediocre and seemed inattentive.
This is my favorite restaurant in the Eastern time zone. The pizza is GREAT. Actually, everything I’ve ever tried here is GREAT. oh yeah and Blendi is the best!
Good place for families.
Delicious food and amazing service. They made the whole family feel at home.
Classic. Great. The food. The service. If you're a fan of classic Italian fare, this place has it!
Slow service, long wait for food, and food was just so so... not impressed...
Great experience for me. Food was great.  The service was outstanding.
Great

They padded the bill by $50 thinking we wouldn't notice on the $1200 bill - 10 people.  They then came up with a story about "finding" a $50 bill on the floor near the register.  No matter how good the food, I will never go there again.

This is probably my favorite place in Arthur Ave which is saying a lot given how good the average place in this neighborhood is.  No offense to little Italy in Manhattan but it simply doesn't touch Arthur Ave in the Bronx.  I personally love the gnocchi but everything is great.  Could probably due with a facelift one of these days but I personally enjoy the decor as it let's you know it's one of the OG places in the hood.  Many places in the area are no longer owned by neighborhood families ... This one is! It has been around for 100+ years and I hope it stays around for 100 more and that my kids get to share the gnocchi and other deliciousness with their kids and their kids kids.

I hosted a group of our physicians at Mario's restaurant for a meeting. I had never eaten at Mario's, but apparently every doctor had, and when I read their choices included Mario's Salmon Regina, every single doctor ordered the Salmon Regina, they didn't even want to hear the other choices so I ordered the Salmon Regina too! Mario serves the salmon Regina with the most delicious Dijon cream sauce I've ever tasted! Not only is it delicious, but it pairs beautifully with salmon! Mario's has hit their sweet spot with their Salmon Regina! Considering that was 20 years ago and I am STILL raving about it, you can be confident in dining at Mario's! So take it from me and 20+ doctors, order the Salmon Regina!
Great food!!
Best pizza in New York City.
Delicious homemade Italian food like Mama used to make!
Not great. I had the shell fish linguini and it tasted old. Very disappointing for such an established restaurant. The wait staff was great, though.
This was the first restaurant my boyfriend and I tried in Little Italy; we’ve never tried anywhere else because this place is that good.
The best italian restaurant in NYC. A true gem this business is.

I was born in the Bronx and I use to come here when I was a little girl So I wanted to impress my friends I and so I did the food is amazing what is important is our waiter Manuel he was great very attentive so when you visit Mario’s ASK FOR MANUEL you will not be disappointed..... Thank You CAROLANN 💜💜

A Classic staple of the orignal Arthur Ave restaurants.  This treasure opened in 1919 and has been serving large portioned meals with warm traditional hospitable service on the block for what feels like forever. A reservation is recommended to get a table in the classically decorated old school dining room . With cozy tables nestled next to each other you'll feel taken back as to what family style dining was, is, and should be. They have great staff that will make recommendations and tell you what they truely think. For our appetizers I ordered a burrata plate which was soft moist and simply over flowing with taste. To go with that we also had a shrimp cocktail and a salad for 2. The fresh super light bread which was amazing was used to sop up anything left on the plate. Then we ordered for the 2 of us a A plate of Noki Sorrentina. Soften potato noodles with red sauce, ricotta, and mozzarella. Bursting with flavor. My wife ordered the chicken scarpiello which was tasty, well rounded and beautifully done. Chicken was soft tender, and not drowing in sauce. The peppers were so tasty. I had the real sorrentina which was wonderful. Fresh eggplant , and prosciutto and. a light crispy breading that flakes when I ate it. Wow. For desert we had traditional coffee paired with a strawberry covered cheese cake tart, also added a rainbow cake which was epic as well as a chocolate whipped cream cake. My meal was amazing naturally with left overs. All the foods we tasted were freshly made and had material from the neighborhood.  Great staff and a chef that walks around and greets people so he show his passion for cooking. Bring your appetite ,and doggie bag for left overs. A great place where food is made with  love and has been for 100 years strong. MARIOS GOTTA GO..
Very good Italian food! Very recommended!
I just like their food. I always get great customer service there. The place is well kept and the workers are always very welcoming. Will come visit again.
Food was perfect 👌 nice atmosphere and staff was very attentive.
Food was average for Italian food in NYC. Great old school history. Service was acceptable..
Really nice restaurant. Great Italian food.
Always an excellent meal, great waitstaff,  tasty desserts

The food was excellent and the staff was great.  I had the veal parmesan amazing

Would absolutely recommend visiting this place. Exceptional character, flavorful dishes, excellent customer service. Keep up the good work.
Great service, delicious food!
Omg I love this restaurant
Some of the best food in Little Italy.
Good food

Food was delicious and the service was lovely.  They even have free parking prior to 4:30 in their own lot across the street (and down a little ways- check Google maps!), which can be a lifesaver on busy Arthur Avenue!
Everything was good but my linguine on white clam sauce needs lots of improvement.
Food was just eh. Didn’t taste like authentic Italian food.
Wonderful specials with truly  a 1st class staff It's no wonder Mario's has been serving delicious food for 100 years on Arthur ave.

Lunch date went very well. Welcoming front service, food was delicious. There pickled carrots are a nice complement to the bread and olive oil starter. Ambience is soft and lovely. Great place a for a date or even family dinner.

Excellent food, service and ambiance.
This is my favorite restaurant in the world. Fantastic food, superb service, and just a delightful combination of atmosphere and yumminess.
The atmosphere and food is fantastic
We went there with a group and as that goes you get the pre packaged meal that gets you feed and out the door.
The service was really great and totally made this restaurant. Food is solid.
Felt like i was in Bronx Tale...owner has great stories
Authentic pasta with genuinely ni e service

Such a great place for a family dinner!! The family came together to celebrate my nephews graduation!!!  From the moment we walked in as a group of 10 hungry and overheated individuals,  it felt like we were at grandma's house.  The staff was warm and patient, while the food and drinks seemed never ending and superbly delicious!!!  The regularly is well maintained  and great for a celebration or an evening out.  From my family to yours, Thank You all who making what seemed like the perfect day even more memorable!!!
Everything was delicious amd amazing!

Some say that over the years like much of Arthur Ave's famed strip, Mario's has lost a bit if its luster....but if u ask me and my son we would be quick to contradict. Now granted we only snuck in to order one of their famed pies but we immediately felt like we were brought back to n old school italian mob dinner feel not to stereotype just the ambiance was classic old country n it's perfect...the pie came oozing with cheese n slathered n their legendary gravy...the thin well proofed crust never stood a chance of holdin up but the crust was light n chewy with that 00 flour taste 👌. The overall experience was great and their most gracious host a charm and delight for decades himself alone is worth a trip out...but come by the food is still great
Sliced low moisture mozz on a very crisp, well-fermented crust. A good example of NYC pizza!
Great service can't wait to  go back
(Translated by Google) The best place to eat like in an Italian house  (Original) El mejor lugar para comer como en una casa italiana

(Translated by Google) Mediocre food. Nothing special for a lot of money. Pasta and lasagna for four. Snacks - very small portions. Caprese like from the store  (Original) Посредственная еда. Ничего особенного за немалые деньги. Паста и лазанья на четверочку. Закуски - очень маленькие порции. Капрезе как будто из магазина
Food was fantastic and delicious 😋

We had a wonderful time this evening at dinner, following our Schiller Institute New York City Chorus Concert at the beautiful Church, Our Lady of Mount Carmel, which the local restaurants and bakeries had helped to advertise and even donated delicacies for our reception.  We were a party of  Schiller Institute Choral singers and friends, and Mario's staff of congenial waiters, and the owner himself, greeted and treated us like family. There were other families there with young children, and everyone seemed to be at home in the restaurant. The food was excellent, with generous portions (enough to take home!) and perfect pastas from homemade manicotti, to delectable seafood dishes,  pasta in vodka sauce with prosciutto, and a very fine wine selection. Everyone loved the tiramisu and other desserts -- it was the  perfect place to celebrate our successful Concert, and we could not have asked for better service!

Not my favorite restuarant, but the people r nice, it can get crowded, so obviously the food has to be good. They have a coat check and parking, for a price. If not u can always search for street parking. The bx19,bx9, and bx17 are near by. Theres a pharmacy walking distance, as well as a hospital, so even emergencies are covered.
The food was very good. It takes some time to get it once you order because they make everything fresh. It's a bit pricey but I would recommend.
It's too pricey but great food
Paper thin lasagne pasta to die for!!! Excellent service!

Like something out of 50s movie. An old-fashioned Italian restaurant that brings back the good old New York. Because, it’s never changed.  The northern Italians may dominate the contemporary restaurant scene, but for fresh, rich, abundant food, you can't beat Naples. Marios's puts the *red" in red sauce. There are great antipasti, pasta, and main courses, rounded off with delicious desserts. And their portions are enough for two Manhattanites. Spuzzulare!  Friends from the Fordham neighborhood brought me here, to the Belmont section, on Easter. Maybe people were wearing their Easter Sunday best, but it was great to see a restaurant full of people of all ages in dresses and suits. Every table was multi-generational. And down to the smallest customer, everyone was eating happily, talking, gesturing dramatically, all at the same time.  Get to the Bronx! Mario's is worth the trip.
Wonderful food, big portions and good service with very personable staff.
Delicious food. Kind people and comfortable place for a romantic Italian dinner or to share with friends and family.
Very good old style Italian
100 years in business. Need I say more?
Delicious food.

Had the pizza which is not good.  It was dry. Tasteless. Sauceless. Greaseless. Brittle.  The place is known as best pizza of the Bronx - went there yesterday and could not eat more.  Was sorry I had a slice.  I can say that there are much better options in your own town versus coming here.  New York has much better pizza and this one is best avoided.  To get an idea of what my opinion of good pizza is: Greasy, juicy, cheesy stretch goodness, bubbley crust slightly charred, sauce that goes pop with richness.  Prince Street Pizza is a good example a bit pricey but yum yummy.
Classic, old-school Italian, but not as good as the modern places. Service had a few lapses
An old favorite of the whole family. Generations have loved this establishment. I cannot wait to return!
A friend took me here for pizza, but it's not the place to go for pizza. It was disappointing. If you want other Italian fare then it's fine.
Food was delicious.  Can't wait to go back.

Food was yummy, above average, but not excellent.  Mario’s is a typical “local” Italian restaurant - noisy, casual and friendly. My friend found this restaurant on internet, and it was our first time to visit Bronx. Both of us were very surprised to know that there was an Italian Town in Bronx. Restaurants and meat shops in the neighbourhood were very decent and middle-class.
Great food , even better service !!
WOW!! All I can say is, THE FOOD IS AMAZING!! Great place, great atmosphere! Our waiter was wonderful!! Very friendly and professional staff! We live in Brooklyn and CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK AGAIN!!💙

Amazing ambiance, family or romantic . We love the fresh pasta , one of the best ones it's Lobster raviolis ,nice restaurant in the middle of Arthur Av. BRONX . The only complain that we have it's with the hostess in the entrance,  have a bad bad attitude the 2 last times that we were there ,and having reservations and she never change her bad face and nasty attitude , I wish that they work on that , no just the amazing food make a place . Still we recommend the food , fresh crunchy Italian bread and nice attention on the table.
Love this place
Good food and great atmosphere in Italian community in Bronx.
Good old fashioned Italian dining

Best penne alla vodka I've had in a very long time, possibly ever! Sadly that's probably all I'll ever get here now because it was so good lol. Great service, good bread, delicious pickled carrots they bring out, and free valet parking. I'm going to try hard to make it to other Arthur Ave spots, but this has definitely been my favorite so far
Authentic Italian, Little Italy Bronx.

Best pizza around!!!  I have bee going here for 35 years, my dad took us from NJ and we would pick up 4-5 pies, now I am taking my son along with my dad for 4-5 pies.  Not sure about the other food, lol, but the pie is perfect.
Loved the food.

(Translated by Google) Food excellent, friendly service, very honest price. Place to take the family. Real Italian food!  (Original) Comida excelente, atendimento simpático, preço muito honesto. Lugar para levar a família. Comida italiana de verdade!
Perfect Food. Perfect, cozy.
Food was good
Great red gravy place
Great place for an early dinner on a cold lazy afternoon. Staff was fun and helped make a great meal greater.
Great!
What a great Atmosphere!! Go got the live music night, the most fun we've had in years!! The food....come on, it's Mario's!!!! DELISH!!!!

Amazing. I don't even want to write words to describe it because then you're going to want to go there and it's going to be busier and I like it when it's quiet.  Pizza is amazing. Everything is old school day one. Appreciated.
Excellent food and service
In the function room for a birthday party.
Great restaurant! Enjoyed their pizza. Had veal francese excellent. It was crowded but we got a table for seven. Super wait staff.

This was my first time here and I had a wonderful experience. We went on a Friday night and we were able to get seated right away. I recommend going around 6:30ish before the dinner crowd really gets settled in. For appetizers we had the fresh mozzarella and tomato plate. They also automatically bring freshly baked bread with olive oil and sliced peppers. For my entree, I got the cacciatore. Some of my chicken pieces were slightly rubbery, but those were only a few small pieces. Otherwise, the flavor of the sauce was delicious. While the entree and appetizers were great, the dessert was the most delicious of all. Highly recommend the tiramisu and also get the espresso with a dash of anisette. Perfect ending to a delicious dinner. We will definitely be back.

Horrible restaurant. Food is not good. Terrible service. Ambience is poor. Very loud and obnoxious. I made a birthday reservation on Open Table. You were supposed to get a free dessert for your birthday. At the end of my entree, I was handed a check. My waiter not only did not give me a dessert, but did not even ask if I wanted anything else. I would never go here again.

We asked for lasagna and fettuccine Alfredo.. both were really good.. portions are huge!.. also you get a free dessert on your birthday. Cocktails are good and the price is ok.

Our all time favorite restaurant. Great food. All food on the menue exceeds expectations. Old type of service from the entire staff. They make you feel very special.

Great ambience, food, and service. Has a formal feel but casual attire is welcomed.

They also automatically bring freshly baked bread with olive oil and sliced peppers. For my entree, I got the cacciatore. Some of my chicken pieces were slightly rubbery, but those were only a few small pieces. Otherwise, the flavor of the sauce was delicious. Awesome!!
Good food, Good restaurant
Good food, obviously this place has been here forever. Rather dark. Attentive (sometimes too much) staff. Met my expectations for an Italian dinner on Arthur Ave.
Wasn't impressed. Being on the famous Arthur Ave in the Bronx, I had high expectations. The food was mediocre and the service wasn't bad. The food was bland and not worthy of an another visit.
Excellent service
Fun neighborhood and very good restaurant.  A traditional location on a fun street in the Italian section of the Bronx.
The best southern italian food you can find on this continent. And reasonably priced.
Great service and food! My family's first time eating there. All were pleased.
Excellent food & service
Generous portions and good food
We ordered food and also had a great pizza. Perfect meal

Until yesterday 5/11 when I lunched at Mario's, I found this restaurant wonderful in every way.  Yesterday, however, was a bad experience.  The escarole I ordered was under cooked, the Lasagna I had was not heated up enough -  a small portion was reasonably hot, but the rest was luke warm.  I wanted it heated up.   Twice I had to get up from my table to get the attention of and speak to a waiter with my request.  It seemed instead of having my original plate of Lasagna heated up, it was replaced by another order of Lasagna which did not taste nearly as good as the first!!!!  (miscommunication and possibly a cook who resented criticism). I was told a sous chef was in charge of the kitchen that day.  I do not want to see this restaurant with a wonderful Italian-American history and great food go down the tubes because of the carefree staff  and an untalented cook  I experienced that day..
Serving up pizza for nearly 100 years. Had the honor of eating one of the Joseph's delicious pizzas. I love this man! Joe's family opened Mario's pizzeria in 1919.
What can I say all their dishes are great. Drinks also.
Love the spiedini Alla Romano and the fried calamari!!!   It's like one big happy family and everyone is Italian.
Food and service are great.  Stop by every time I visit Arthur Ave.
Great food
Joey diaz podcast always brings this restaurant up saying it's the realest Italian food
Great atmosphere and fine food, this is the real deal!
Good Food, Reasonable Prices, Large Portions. What More do you need to know? Third Generation Family Run. Warm semolina bread, nice wines and a friendly staff. Make a Reservation!
Not at par with other restaurants in Authur Avenue. The food was just OK, nothing too fabulous.
1st time here. Absolutely love it!!! Food was delicious!
Old school Italian restaurant. Great food!
Mario's has become our go to place on Arthur Avenue after Yankee games.  The food is excellent!
Authentic Italian food delicious friendly staff I must visit if you're at author Avenue
Food was very good.
The food was incredible, the history of the place was also beautiful and the stories the waiter told us were so fun and helped us appreciate.
very good pizza and good italian american food
Consistently great good, friendly atmosphere.
Great food and ambiance! Service was also fantastic! Super authentic!
Portion size was just right,atmosphere had a touch of old italy

We reserved a table for a Birthday,  it is a very nice family oriented restaurant. Even a dinner for two. They had live jazz music, we ordered pizza as a appetizer Delicious ! All of our entrees were delicious, the best Meatballs, and Lasagna. We loved it. Our family will be going back to Arthur ave . for Mario's Italian delicious food.
Great food.
Wonderful family owned place on Arthur Ave. Delicious food and always get service with a laugh and a smile as if you're part of the family.
Some of the best pizza I’ve ever had. You’ve got to eat here!
The food was excellent, along with our waiter Ben, who made our first experience at Mario's a memorable one. We will definitely be back!
Great food, knowledgeable staff, relaxed setting, could not have been happier.
Great food. I thought I was in italy
Wonderful dishes, but the serving size was twice what I needed, and I'm a big boy. Salads were good, but overpriced ($8.25).

This is a wonderful family owned restaurant. Joe is a wonderful guy I used to work for this restaurant back in 1976 and 1977 and before I work there I used to eat there. I would go back there and eat there it has a wonderful selection the look weenie with the white clam sauce oh my God is off the chain. The lasagna is immaculate, the shrimp scampi is I don't think there's another place anywhere that serves shrimp scampi the way they do this is a wonderful place it's over on Arthur Avenue in The Bronx, New York.

I went with a group of five for dinner and the place was packed. Total wait time? 10 minutes! I cook for a living so it takes a lot to impress me, but they managed to quite easily. Great service, friendly staff, and outstanding dishes for everyone I dined with. I ordered the filet mignon, and received the best cooked steak that I had not cooked myself in a very long time. If I'm ever in the Bronx again, I will eat here and bring everyone I know.
Good for. Family's. Food is decent classic Italian.
Very busy. Attentive crew. Delicious food!
Great service !
(Translated by Google) Delicious, nice  (Original) Riquísimo, agradable
It is all good here...joe the owner is  prince!
Food was not hot, a bit rubbery, and too sweet. Service was satisfactory.
5 star Service, Atmosphere and Food
Excellent food, awesome service at good Price's..And they even have valet parking down the block..
Classic and delicious food with lots of atmosphere and very attentive staff.

The service we received yesterday was incredible especially by our waiter. We came here to celebrate my mother's  birthday, little did we know that this is a birthday spot or a celebrational spot for friends and family. The food was good and decent especially my artichoke chicken special. This restaurant has that old school New York Italian style which is what we wanted. Thank you.
The food was excellent and the service was pretty good too. It's not cheap, but it's a good spot for a date or family party.
Good food great service....
We had an Outstanding homemade italian meal.  Delicious from apps to the canoli dessert.  Love Mario's.  It's The BEST
Horrible place! Dont go here.... waiters are unfriendly and rude. Bread is very nice though!
The restaurant was okay, the food was ok, the staff was ok, but nothing special. I guess I expected a little more from all the Arthur ave. hype.
Best cannoli I've ever had and the Alla Vodka sauce is out of this world! 😍
Very slow. At 90 min still no dinner. When I jokingly the waiter we were going to leave he told is to go ahead and go! Dinner was good but not excellent. Don't go on a weekend!!
